items.title: Live: Nationals cannot remain in Coalition while Sussan Ley is opposition leader, Littleproud says
items.description: After quitting the shadow ministry en masse in solidarity with three colleagues dumped for crossing the floor on hate laws, Nationals leader David Littleproud says his party has been forced into an "untenable position" and will leave the Coalition. Follow live.

items.title: The optics are diabolical, as chaos reigns on a supposed day of mourning
items.description: Littleproud and his team have now basically broken one of the most fundamental political rules of the Coalition — the Nationals are now effectively dictating to the Liberals who their leader should be.

items.title: March for Australia admins encouraged people to join White Australia Party
items.description: March for Australia organisers are planning a fresh round of mass demonstrations across the country on January 26, with members encouraging others to join the now disbanded White Australia Party.

items.title: Live: Several people missing after landslide hits New Zealand campsite
items.description: Several people are missing after a landslide at a campsite in the tourism hotspot of Mount Maunganui, south-east of Auckland.

items.title: In Davos, European leaders met Trump with strength and he backed down
items.description: European leaders will be breathing a sigh of relief that the extraordinary threat of a US invasion of Greenland has receded. But some things cannot be undone.

items.title: Rate hike expectations jump after jobs data comes in 'stronger' than expected
items.description: Australia's unemployment rate fell from 4.3 to 4.1 per cent in December, according to seasonally adjusted figures from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

items.title: Stones instead of flowers, 30 days of Shloshim: How the Jewish community mourns
items.description: On the National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, Rabbi Jacqueline Ninio shares what mourning looks like in Jewish culture, from the resonance of stones at gravesites to a month-long period of grieving.

items.title: CSIRO PhD candidate accused of planning Australia Day terror attack
items.description: Sepehr Saryazdi has been accused of planning to use Molotov cocktails and lead a "riot" at the Gold Coast on Australia Day.

items.title: Family of Manly shark attack survivor calls for 'positive energy'
items.description: Andre de Ruyter is described by his family as a talented musician who loves surfing.

items.title: Brisbane girls' school principal resigns following leaking scandal
items.description: A prestigious Brisbane girls' school principal will resign, following a scandal where personal student information was leaked to the public.

items.title: Australian retiree's detention in Thailand a warning, lawyer says
items.description: Rights groups slam Thai authorities' detention and legal proceedings against Australian writer Murray Hunter, after Malaysia's communications regulator submitted a criminal defamation complaint.

items.title: Live: Novak Djokovic trying to teach Australian Open 101 on day five
items.description: The second round of the Australian Open singles continues with Novak Djokovic hunting his 101st win, before Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek hit the court, while Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis kick off their doubles campaign. Follow live.

items.title: Live: ASX pares gains as bets of February rate hike rise
items.description: The Australian share market has pared early gains as bets of a February rate hike rise on strong employment in December. Follow live.

items.title: Former police officer acquitted in trial over response to Uvalde school shooting
items.description: A former officer charged with child abandonment and endangerment over the police response to the Uvalde school massacre in 2022 is acquitted.

items.title: ‘Three-legged wombat crocodiles’: AI wreaks havoc on tourism website
items.description: Weldborough in remote north-east Tasmania has lots of natural beauty. But it does not have hot springs — and it is causing headaches for locals.

items.title: Guide dog handler left a 'bit stunned' by drive-by confrontation
items.description: Adelaide woman Nicole Willing, who has a vision impairment, said she was recently walking in Belair with guide dog Jetta when a driver stopped and "blurted out a mouthful", claiming it was too hot for her to be walking her dog.

items.title: For 50 years, ABC Classic has connected music lovers across Australia
items.description: From late-life love stories to musical discoveries, presenters reveal what has made ABC Classic special for audiences for 50 years.

items.title: 'I want them to stop': Sawfish and sharks found mutilated
items.description: Residents and experts say they are shocked and concerned after social media images showed a number of endangered and protected marine animals impaled and severed on a stretch of WA coastline in just a few weeks.

items.title: Victoria's coal country set to become home of $10 billion data centre
items.description: Victoria's east is set to become home to a $10 billion data centre that will support the technology necessary for artificial intelligence systems.

items.title: Coloured windows to stay at Sydney's QVB after public backlash to plan
items.description: An application on behalf of Vicinity Centres sought to make the coloured glass windows in some of the building's shopfronts clear to improve store visibility.

items.title: Colonial monuments vandalised, graffitied in Melbourne gardens
items.description: Vandals have destroyed a 155-year-old monument and graffitied another in Melbourne's Flagstaff Gardens overnight.

items.title: Debt is America's Achilles heel in a fracturing world order
items.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

items.title: 'Ten-pound Pom' vows to boycott UK over 'money grab' passport changes
items.description: People who came to Australia as children from the UK as part of an organised migration scheme say they the UK's new regulations for dual citizens unfairly targets them.

items.title: Australia earns global praise for economic 'soft landing'
items.description: A new report from the OECD says Australia's economy is returning to normal but remains vulnerable and lacks dynamism.

items.title: Tobacco companies targeting gen Z through social media
items.description: Experts say Australia risks becoming complacent in the war against tobacco, with big companies pivoting to social media to "greenwash" their products to generation Z.
